string-array.name: resturant_sultan
string-array.item: Stuff are professional and very nice.A special Turkish taste, outdoor seats available in one of the best locations in Riyadh.

string-array.name: resturant_indian
string-array.item: We were craving for Indian food while we were in Riyadh. Our friend took us to this restaurant. We sat in a closed family booth as this is Riyadh

string-array.name: resturant_Kampai
string-array.item: Some of my friends told me that Kampai is one of the best places to eat sushi at. I actually felt that it is quite overrated. The sushi was fresh and good, however, I did not find anything special either about the taste

string-array.name: resturant_hamza
string-array.item: I visited their King Abdul Aziz Riyadh branch for take away. The Fried Kanad was good and I also ordered some shrimps. Lately I visited the Khurais Road Riyadh branch, place is good but at time too much crowded.

string-array.name: staduim_king_fahd
string-array.item: The stadium was built in 1987, being among the first ones to be covered with membrane. More importantly, it instantly became the venue with World’s largest roof. Its surface of 47,000 sqm allowed King Fahd’s stadium to retain the status for almost two decades. The cover is supported by 24 tall pylons and due to dynamic shape resembles a Bedouin tent.

string-array.name: staduim_king_abdullah
string-array.item: Erection of Jeddah’s new sports centre was announced in a king’s decree in 2009, suggesting the city will again celebrate sport’s role in society. Initial plans envisaged a main stadium for 100,000 people and numerous other buildings spread over 900 hectares. In 2011 the plan was severely downscaled. The surface was reduced to 300 hectares, stadium capacity to 60,000, while secondary amenities limited to an athletic stadium, 2,000-capacity indoor arena, training pitches and a mosque.

string-array.name: staduim_prince_faisal
string-array.item: The stadium was built between Jeddah’s university and industrial district in 1970. It’s part of a larger sports complex along with and indoor hall and a natatorium. For almost three decades the only stand equipped in individual seats was the main one that also provides partial cover for fans. The remaining sections forming a “C” shape had terracing until 2009. Along with conversion into all-seater mode its capacity decreased from 23,000 to 20,000.

string-array.name: staduim_ksu
string-array.item: Construction work on the campus of King Saud University in western Riyadh were launched in the spring of 2011 and expected to end within 24 months. However, despite the stadium being structurally ready in 2014, opening only took place in May of 2015.

string-array.name: his_1
string-array.item: In the midst of rolling golden sands an oasis emerged with gardens of date palms. Riyadh, a name derived from the Arabic plural form of rowdah (gardens) was not always the capital, as previously the 500 year old walled city of Ad-Diriyah was the seat of the Al Saud tribe

string-array.name: his_2
string-array.item: Riyadh's roots and time-honored history continue to make their presence felt – here is a place where ancient mosques and contemporary malls exist side by side

string-array.name: his_3
string-array.item: is another wonderful place for people to visit, containing eight sections that cover topics such as man and the universe, Arabian Kingdoms, Prophet Mohammed’s Mission, Islam and the Arabian Peninsula

string-array.name: his_4
string-array.item: In the midst of rolling golden sands an oasis emerged with gardens of date palms. Riyadh, a name derived from the Arabic plural form of rowdah (gardens) was not always the capital, as previously the 500 year old walled city of Ad-Diriyah was the seat of the Al Saud tribe
